question_text: Anxious mood: Worries, anticipation of the worst, fearful anticipation, irritability.
Tension: Feelings of tension, fatigability, startle response, moved to tears easily, trembling, feelings of restlessness, inability to relax.
Fears: Of dark, of strangers, of being left alone, of animals, of traffic, of crowds.
Insomnia: Difficulty in falling asleep, broken sleep, unsatisfying sleep and fatigue on waking, dreams, nightmares, night terrors.
Intellectual: Difficulty in concentration, poor memory.
Depressed mood: Loss of interest, lack of pleasure in hobbies, depression, early waking, diurnal swing.
Somatic (muscular): Pains and aches, twitching, stiffness, myoclonic jerks, grinding of teeth, unsteady voice, increased muscular tone.
Somatic (sensory): Tinnitus, blurring of vision, hot and cold flushes, feelings of weakness, pricking sensation.
Cardiovascular symptoms : Tachycardia, palpitations, pain in chest, throbbing of vessels, fainting feelings, missing beat.
Respiratory symptoms: Pressure or constriction in chest, choking feelings, sighing, dyspnea
Gastrointestinal symptoms: Difficulty in swallowing, wind abdominal pain, burning sensations, abdominal fullness, nausea, vomiting, borborygmi, looseness of bowels, loss of weight, constipation.
Genitourinary symptoms: Frequency of micturition, urgency of micturition, amenorrhea, menorrhagia, development of frigidity, premature ejaculation, loss of libido, impotence.
Autonomic symptoms : Dry mouth, flushing, pallor, tendency to sweat, giddiness, tension headache, raising of hair.
Behavior at interview: Fidgeting, restlessness or pacing, tremor of hands, furrowed brow, strained face, sighing or rap
Numbness or tingling
Feeling hot

Hands trembling
Shaky / unsteady
Fear of losing control
Difficulty in breathing
Fear of dying
Scared

Faint / lightheaded
Face flushed
Hot / cold sweats
Is the patient very nervous, worried, or frightened for no apparent reason? Does he/she seem very tense or fidgety? Is the patient afraid to be apart from you?
Over the past week have you felt nervous, worried, or tense?
Over the past 7 days, have you heard voices, music or other sounds when there was no clear explanation for them? Or when no one else could hear them?

Over the past 7 days, have you seen things or images when there was no clear explanation for them? Or when no one else could see them? For example people, animals, shadows, specific patterns or objects?

Over the past 7 days, have you felt sensations on or inside your body when there was no clear explanation for them? For example, the feeling of being touched or a hand being placed on your shoulder, while there is no one else around? If yes: How often have you felt these sensations? For example, have you felt them every day, about once a day, every hour of the day, almost continuously?

Over the past 7 days, have you smelt scents when there was no clear explanation for them? For example the smell of flowers or smoke, while there were no flowers or fire? 
If yes: How often have you had these sensations? For example, have you smelt them every day, about once a day, every hour of the day, almost continuously?

Have you ever had the feeling that others may want to harm you, are watching you, are unfaithful, or are conspiring against you? Or did you think that some people cannot be trusted or that you are being deceived?
answer_options: [A, B, C]

question_text: Did you ever have the idea that strangers are talking about you? Or that certain messages on TV or in a magazine are meant especially for you or are used to convey a secret message to you?
answer_options: [A, B, C]

question_text: Did you ever have the idea that you have done something terrible? Or that you need to be punished for something?
answer_options: [A, B, C]

question_text: Did you ever feel that you are being controlled by someone else, or by an outside force? That is, something outside of your own control.
answer_options: [A, B, C]

question_text: Are you a religious person? If you feel comfortable, could you tell something about this? Do you think you have been chosen by God, i.e. for a special purpose or mission in life? Have you had an unusual religious experiences?
answer_options: [A, B, C]

question_text: Is there something you would really like to achieve in life? And how would you think you can achieve this? Did you ever think you have special powers or talents that others do not have? Do you think you will achieve great things in life?
answer_options: [A, B, C]

question_text: Have you ever been convinced that there is something strange with your body, while doctors and others tell you this is not the case? For example, are you sure there is some kind of device implanted in your body while the doctors tell you this is not the case? Or are you convinced you are pregnant while tests suggest you are not? Or do you think you have a parasite although doctors tell you this is not true?
answer_options: [A, B, C]

question_text:
Did you ever have the feeling that you are already dead, or no longer exist? 
Or is a part of your body already dead?
answer_options: [A, B, C]

question_text:
Did you ever believe a person close to you has been replaced by an imposter? 
Or do you believe your house is not your real house?
answer_options: [A, B, C]

question_text:
Did you perceive (see, hear, feel, smell) things that you knew were not there or that other
people didn’t perceive? When you perceived it, did you realize it was not real? Did you
sometimes act upon these phenomena (for instance tried to touch it)? Did these
phenomena scare you? Did you get agitated or aggressive when you noticed these
phenomena or when someone tried to convince you they were not real?

Did you perceive (see, hear) things differently then they really were (for instance a person
instead of a tree, a bug instead of a crumb)? When you perceived them, did you realize it
was not real? Did you sometimes act upon these phenomena (for instance tried to touch
them)? Did these phenomena scare you? Did you get agitated or aggressive when you
noticed these phenomena or when someone tried to convince you they were not real?

Were you more suspicious or jealous then you should be? (For instance were you
convinced that people were having "bad thoughts" about you, that people were stealing
from you). Did you wrongfully accuse people? Did these thoughts make you more tense or
aggressive?

Did you dream more then you used to? Do you recall vivid or unpleasant dreams? Has
someone told you that you moved, talked or screamed while sleeping? Were you aware of
having had a dream when you woke up, were you afraid, agitated or confused?

Were you able to think as clearly as you used to? Were you able to concentrate? (on a
book or a conversation?) How was your memory? (Did you forget what you were doing?)
How was your orientation? (Did you always know where you were, could you find your
way; did you know what day/month it was or whether it was morning or evening; did you
always know who a familiar person was). How coherent was your speech (Did you
sometimes stop when talking because you couldn’t focus on the topic or made an illogical
switch to another subject?)

Did you dream or think more about sex or did your sex drive increase? Did you get angry
or aggressive when your desires couldn’t be fulfilled?

Are your thoughts more occupied by a desire to shop or gamble? Did you spend more
time or money on shopping or gambling? Was it difficult to control your thoughts or
behavior? Did this behavior lead to financial problems or problems in daily life?

The patient reports voices, noises, or other sounds that no one
else hears.
The patient reports hearing two or more voices conversing.
The patient reports experiencing peculiar physical sensations in the body.
The patient sees shapes or people that are not actually present.

The patient believes he is being conspired against or persecuted
in some way.

The patient believes his spouse is having an affair with
someone.

The patient believes that insignificant remarks or events refer
to him or have special meaning.
Over the past week have you seen, heard, smelled, or felt things that were not really there?

Does the patient have beliefs that you know are not true (for example, insisting that people are trying to harm him/her or steal from him/her)? Has he/she said that family members are not who they say they are or that the house is not their home? I’m not asking about mere suspiciousness; I am interested if the patient is convinced that these things are happening to him/her.

Does the patient have hallucinations such as seeing false visions or hearing false voices? Does he/she seem to see, hear or experience things that are not present? By this question we do not mean just mistaken beliefs such as stating that someone who has died is still alive; rather we are asking if the patient actually has abnormal experiences of sounds or visions.
Visual hallucinations
answer_options: ["Absent", "Occasional; complete or partial insight; nonthreatening", "Frequent; absence of full insight; can be convinced; may be threatening", "Persistent hallucinations; no insight; associated with hightened emotional tone, agitation, aggression"]

question_text: Illusions and Misidentification of Persons
answer_options: ["Absent", "Occurring infrequently", "Occurring very often", "Occurring persistently"]

question_text: Paranoid Ideation (persecutory and/or jealous type)
answer_options: ["Absent", "Associated with suspiciousness", "Associated with tension and excitement", "Accussations of family members, aggression and/or lack of cooperation (i.e. refsal to eat and/or take medication"]

question_text: Sleep Disturbances
answer_options: ["Absent", "Associated with anxiety", "Night terrors with recurrent awakening and feelings of danger", "Nightmares with recurrent awakenings, associated with agitation and confusion"]

question_text: Confusion
answer_options: ["Absent", "Disorientation in time/place/person", "Confusion combined with impaired attention/concentration/registration/recall/interruption of goal-directed actions"]

question_text: Sexual Preoccupation
answer_options: ["Absent", "Thoughts, dreams, worry about sexual competence", "Increased demand for sexual activity", "Violent sexual impulsiveness"]

question_text: Do you experience hallucinations? (Have you noticed anything unusual about your vision? Have you had any unusual visual experiences? Or ever see/hear/feel/smell/taste things that are not really there or that other people do not see?)

question_text: How many times a week do you engage in your hobby?

question_text: In general, do you decide to do things or does someone have to push you a little?
answer_options: ["I have to be pushed", "NA", "I decide to do things myself"]

question_text: When you have to go to an appointment, a meeting or a formal occasion, do you have to be told to get yourself ready?
answer_options: ["I need to be told", "NA", "I get ready spontaneously"]

question_text: When you have to make an appointment (for example with the doctor or dentist), do you do it yourself or do you wait for someone to do it for you?
answer_options: ["I wait for someone to do it for me", "NA", "I do it myself"]

question_text: Do you take part spontaneously in daily living activities or do you need to be asked?
answer_options: ["I have to be asked", "NA", "I take part spontaneously"]

question_text: Do you like finding out about something new (a new TV programme or a new book)?
answer_options: ["No, that doesn't interest me", "NA", "Yes, that interests me"]

question_text: Do you like trying out new products, tools or recipes that you're not familiar with?
answer_options: ["No, that doesn't interest me", "NA", "Yes, I like trying things I'm not familiar with"]

question_text: Do you like visiting places you've never been to before?
answer_options: ["No, that doesn't interest me", "NA", "Yes, I like visiting places I've never been to before"]

question_text: When you go out for a drive or when you're travelling by train or bus, do you enjoy looking at the countryside, the houses?
answer_options: ["No, that doesn't interest me", "NA", Yes, I like to see if anything has changed"]

question_text: When you decide to do something, are you easily able to make an effort or is it difficult?
answer_options: ["I find it difficult to make an effort", "NA", "I can easily make an effort"]

question_text: When you don't manage to do something, do you try to find other solutions?
answer_options: ["No, I give up", "NA", "Yes, I try again"]

question_text: When you decide to do something, do you see it through to the end or do you tend to give up?
answer_options: ["I tend to give up (I am easily discouraged)", "NA", "I see it through to the end"]

question_text: When you can't find something (for example a document or an object), do you go to a lot of trouble looking for it?
answer_options: ["No, if I don't find it quickly, I stop looking", "NA", "Yes, I keep looking until I find it"]

question_text: When you watch a film, do you easily become emotional or moved?
answer_options: ["No, I don't experience any particular emotion", "NA", "Yes, I am easily moved"]

question_text: When someone tells you a joke or when you watch a comedy sketch on TV, do you laugh easily?
answer_options: ["No, I don't experience any particular emotion", "NA", "Yes, it makes me laugh"]

question_text: Do you feel happy when you hear some good news?
answer_options: ["No, I don't experience any particular emotion", "NA", "Yes, I'm happy"]

question_text: Do you feel sad when you hear some bad news?
answer_options: ["No, I don't experience any particular emotion", "NA", "Yes, I'm sad, it worries me"]

question_text: When you have a problem (for example when your TV set breaks down), does it worry you?
answer_options: ["No", "NA", "Yes, I worry easily"]

question_text: When something's not working or when something unexpected happens, do you think about finding a solution?
answer_options: ["No, I give up", "NA", "Yes I look for a solution"]

question_text: When your partner or children have a minor problem (when they're ill, for example), does that concern you, do you worry about them?
answer_options: ["No, I don't feel very concerned about that", "NA", "Yes, I worry"]

question_text: Do you like to ask how your family and friends are on a regular basis?
answer_options: ["No, often I wait until someone tells me how they are", "NA", "Yes, I often ask them how they are (I phone them, etc)"

question_text: Do you have friends?
answer_options: ["No, not many or I don't see them anymore", "NA", "Yes, and having friends matters a lot to me"]

question_text: When you meet friends, do you enjoy spending time with them or it is a chore?
answer_options: ["It's a chore", "NA", "I enjoy it"]

question_text: In conversation, do you start talking or do the others tend to speak to you first?
answer_options: ["I only talk if someone starts talking to me", "NA", "I start talking with no prompting"]

question_text: During a discussion, do you give your own opinion spontaneously or do you fall into line with someone else's opinion?
answer_options: ["I tend to fall into line with someone else's opinion", "NA", "I give my own opinion spontaneously"

question_text: When you've finished doing something, do you take stock of the situation and think about what is going well and what's not?
answer_options: ["No, I don't think about the end result", "NA", "Yes, I take stock of the situation"]

question_text: After having taken a decision, do you sometimes think that you've made the wrong choice?
answer_options: ["No, I'm happy with the choice I made", "NA", "Yes, I sometimes regret having made certain choices"]

question_text: When you've been unpleasant to someone, do you sometimes feel guilty afterwards?
answer_options: ["No, I don't care", "NA", "Yes, I'm ashamed of myself"]

question_text: If, during a discussion, you realize that you're in the wrong, are you able to admit it - at least to yourself?
answer_options: ["No, I don't admit that I'm in the wrong", "NA", "Yes, I admit it"]

question_text: Over the past week, have you felt indifferent to doing activities or being with people?

Has the patient lost interest in the world around him/her? Has he/she lost interest in doing things or does he/she lack motivation for starting new activities? Is he/she more difficult to engage in conversation or in doing chores? Is the patient apathetic or indifferent?
